name: Fire-Roasted Tomato and Pepper Soup
author: Baking Nana
summary: Tomato soup takes a trip south of the border. Fire-roasted tomatoes and roasted peppers capture the fresh taste of summer, all year long.
ingredients: 4  red or yellow bell peppers, seeded and halved
1  yellow banana pepper, seeded and halved
1 bunch cilantro, chopped, plus leaves for garnish
3 (14.5 ounce) cans Hunt's® Fire Roasted Diced Tomatoes, undrained
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Line a large sheet pan with parchment paper
Place peppers, onion and garlic on prepared pan; drizzle with olive oil
Roast in preheated oven until peppers are soft and slightly charred, about 20 minutes
Heat broth in a large soup pot
Add chopped cilantro, oregano, cumin, sugar, freshly ground pepper, and Hunt's Fire Roasted Diced Tomatoes
Add roasted peppers, onions and garlic to the tomato mixture
Using a hand held immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth
Simmer over low heat until hot, about 10 minutes
Serve garnished with Cotija cheese, cilantro and drizzled with lime juice
